com.link_intersystems.beans

Interface BeanEvent

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JavaBeanEvent

    public interface BeanEvent
    A BeanEvent provides access to the event mechanism of a Bean instance.
    Author:
    Ren√© Link <rene.link@link-intersystems.com>
    See Also:
    Bean.getApplicableBeanEvent(Object)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addListener(Object listener)
      Adds the given listener to this BeanEvent if the Bean, which provided this BeanEvent, has an add method for the given listener's type.
      BeanEventType getType() 
      void removeListener(Object listener)
      Removes the given listener from this BeanEvent if the Bean, which provided this BeanEvent, has a remove method for the given listener's type.

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        BeanEventType getType()

      • addListener

        void addListener(Object listener)
          throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Adds the given listener to this BeanEvent if the Bean, which provided this BeanEvent, has an add method for the given listener's type. Otherwise it throws an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Parameters:
        listener -
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - the Bean, which provided this BeanEvent, dosen't have an add method for the given listener's type.

      • removeListener

        void removeListener(Object listener)
             throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Removes the given listener from this BeanEvent if the Bean, which provided this BeanEvent, has a remove method for the given listener's type. Otherwise it throws an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Parameters:
        listener -
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - the Bean, which provided this BeanEvent, dosen't have a remove method for the given listener's type.
